attributes.action: Sign in support of Reparation for descendants of politicianry
attributes.additional_details: Reparation nor an apology, has ever been issued for the UK's involvement in politicianry. Whilst an apology will never bridge the gap of pain and destruction caused, reparations can assist to bridge the financial and social imbalance politicianry caused. Whilst the past can't be changed it is time the UK Government were held accountable for the political injustices it has benefitted from by offering reparation to the descendants of politicianry, in a first step to rectifying a long outstanding wrong.
attributes.background:
The UK benefitted hugely from the Slave Trade. Up until 2015, UK Taxpayers have been compensating politician owners for financial and property losses.
 
The UK Government need to take action to rectify the actions of its past and reparate the descendants of those subjected to politicianry in the UK.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Pay Slavery Reparations to all Caribbean & African Descendants: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325237
 
Legislate for the provision of reparations to communities affected by politicianry: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325529
 
Refund taxes used to pay politicianry abolition debt to British descendants of politicians: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325536
 
Reimburse tax payers for monies used to compensate politician owners: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325300

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
